column4: hey can anyone help me? i've developed an app, which broadcasts udp to 2.255.255.255 - my pc is in 192.168.0.X subnet... - in windows i can manage this with "route add 2.0.0.0 mask 255.0.0.0 192.168.0.10 metric 1" - in linux i tried "route add -net 2.0.0.0 netmask 255.0.0.0 dev wlan0" but it doesnt work... the client in network with ip 2.0.0.1 doesnt recv anything from my linux pc, windows works.... any help?
you could use wireshark to sniff the actual packets being sent and received

i do know wireshark and have it installed, too... - but... i think its a routing problem... when i change my linux ip "ifconfig wlan0 2.0.0.2 netmask 255.0.0.0" then the 2.0.0.1-client receives my broadcast send to 2.255.255.255
